resources.string: Error calculating target score.\nPlease check input values.

This app calculates target scores in weather affected cricket matches using the Duckworth-Lewis method. It uses the Standard Edition which was used for all matches prior to 2003. The current method used for all international matches is the Professional Edition, however using this method requires software which is not publicly available. The results using the Standard Edition are generally similar to those from the Professional Edition, but the results start to diverge for very high first innings totals (around 350 runs and more).

Results are calculated using the over-by-over tables provided in the ICC Playing Handbook 2013-2014. The G50 figure used in the calculation is 245, which is the default for matches involving ICC full member nations and teams playing first class cricket. The ability to change G50 to a custom number is planned for a future version of the app. This app is intended to be used for 50 over matches, but support for Twenty20 matches is also planned for a future version.
